title: Clean Water Reaches Over 5,000 Students in Mirpur
excerpt: Our latest water filtration project has successfully installed 12 industrial-grade systems, providing safe drinking water to underserved schools.
content:
Transforming Health through Hydration

In the heart of Mirpur, school children have long struggled with water-borne illnesses. Last month, our team completed the installation of UV-filtration systems across three primary schools.

The Challenge

Before this intervention, over 30% of students reported absences due to stomach infections. Clean drinking water was a luxury that many families could not afford at home, leading to a cycle of illness and missed education.

Our Impact

  • 1,200+ Students now have daily access to safe water.
  • Reduction in illness: Preliminary data shows a 40% drop in water-related clinic visits.
  • Sustainability: We have trained local staff to maintain the UV-filters weekly.
"Since the filters were installed, my daughter hasn't missed a single day of school. She feels stronger and more focused." — Rahima, Local Parent

This project was made possible by our monthly donors. Together, we are ensuring that no child has to choose between their health and their education.

title: Combating Winter: Emergency Relief Distribution
excerpt: Over 2,000 blankets and winter kits were distributed to families in northern Bangladesh during the severe cold wave.
content:
Warmth for Every Family: Winter Relief Drive

When the temperature drops below 10 degrees, thousands in the northern districts face life-threatening conditions without proper shelter or clothing. This winter, our mission is to ensure no family is left in the cold.

The Current Crisis

In regions like Kurigram and Dinajpur, the seasonal cold wave disproportionately affects children and the elderly. Many families live in bamboo-walled huts that offer little protection against the biting winds.

Our Distribution Strategy

  • Heavy Blankets: Distributing 5,000 high-thermal blankets to rural households.
  • Children's Kits: Providing sweaters, woolen caps, and socks to 2,000 students.
  • Emergency Shelters: Setting up community heating centers in primary schools.

How Your Contribution Helps

A single blanket costs less than a meal out, but for a family in the north, it is a shield against illness. We are currently 60% toward our goal for the 2026 winter season.

"The blanket we received is the first new one we've had in five years. My grandchildren can finally sleep through the night without shivering." — Hasan Ali, Recipient
